page.title: 04ELDERLY IN BISHOPS LYDEARD
page.content: There are the statistically expected number of elderly people living in the village and especial provision has been made for them-as long ago as 1616 Sir Richard Grobham established 10 Alms houses which are now occupied by elderly single people.The Greenway housing estate has a number of bungalows in one area which are primaraly for elderly tenants.The Darby Way estate has 30 purpose-built bungalows with a warden who is availableto assist if required.At the centre of the complex is a meeting room with all facilities and a small kitchen for informal or formal meetings of the elderly of the estate.In this building there is a weekly day centre for 20 or so "frail elderly" who are trasported to and fro home,given a cooked meal and to join in many suitable activities.
